ARTICLE.TITLE: Letter: Struggling governments make others scapegoats
ARTICLE.TEXT:
I thank The Dispatch for the Wednesday editorial "Time to reverse Trump's backward stance on climate change" about the president’s counter-factual views and policies on climate change.

In noting the reactions to young people worldwide demonstrating in favor of a livable future, the editorial noted that their critics “claim the young activists are being manipulated by cynical adults.” This has a familiar ring. Those who resist fundamental change routinely suggest that people are too stupid to act in their own interest.

Defenders of segregation claimed that civil rights protests and activities were caused by “outside agitators” and “communists." College administrators and government officials denounced campus activists protesting the Vietnam War as “dupes” of foreign powers. The president himself never tires of blaming news outlets for reporting the obvious fabrications in his tweets.

People who are, or will be, affected by the destructive practices of government, corporate and social institutions don’t need anyone to urge them to protest being victimized. What they need is for those responsible to take meaningful action to remedy the problems.

Steve Abbott, Columbus
